column5: Wait....when did y'all switch to Fahrenheit  I'm an old geezer I never switched to metric
Wait....when did y'all switch to Fahrenheit  When the temps drop below -40 because it looks even more impressive.

When the temps drop below -40 because it looks even more impressive.  I may not be very metric literate but isn't minus forty the same on both scales so they actually would track pretty close down there.

I may not be very metric literate but isn't minus forty the same on both scales so they actually would track pretty close down there.  Yeah close.. -40 is friggin cold in imperial and freaking cold in metric.
Lol.  Im a metric baby. Id have to look up online what 50 farenheit converts to  Isnt that like +6???? Hahahaha  BUT i measure fish in imperial??

I may not be very metric literate but isn't minus forty the same on both scales so they actually would track pretty close down there.  -40C=-40F -45C=-49F -50C=-58F -55C= -67F -60C= -76F  FYI, we had our first extreme cold weather warning of the winter this morning. They are only issued when the temp/windchill drops below -50C.  B|
When the temps drop below -40 because it looks even more impressive.  It does indeed.........i saw the original post and was trying to convert quickly, and then realized it was already in F lol
It does indeed.........i saw the original post and was trying to convert quickly, and then realized it was already in F lol  So this morning's windchill was -54C or -65.2F. Didn't seem that cold.
Come on up to Yellowknife. We have plenty of ice and the warm tropical breezes are wafting out of the North!!!
Thanks but I'll pass...that "feels like" temp is ridicules!
no wind inside a well constructed ice shack
no wind inside a well constructed ice shack  Enjoy the ride out!!!
- before the temp is a sign, it means stay indoors!
Enjoy the ride out!!! my sled goes quicker than 25kmh  -20's is nothing up there. -30 is when it gets dicey and 40 you are staying home.
How much snow? -45 I can deal with (lived in Edmonton for a year) a 2k hike in 3 feet of snow, I can not.
Feels like -51 ? Lol .... mind numbing for sure !!!!
Enjoy the ride out!!!
Feels like -53
But its a dry cold right?
But its a dry cold right?  I think it goes, cold, damp cold, really cold, dry cold, don't go ice fishing with Drifter cold.
Drifter doesnt even put ice on his rye, he uses liquid nitrogen

How much snow? -45 I can deal with (lived in Edmonton for a year) a 2k hike in 3 feet of snow, I can not.  We need more snow. Only 2"-3" on the lakes and 4"-5" in the bush. Can't sled up to my cabin from the lake at this time because there isn't enough snow. If there still isn't enough by early February I'm going to have to start hauling snow off the lake to have a good enough trail to haul my building materials in.
Drifter doesnt even put ice on his rye, he uses liquid nitrogen  NAW, we freeze our liquor and make boozcicles!!!
Damn! Its colder than liquid nitrogen!!!  Boozcicles???
Damn! Its colder than liquid nitrogen!!!  Boozcicles  Don't laugh, since I've been up here we have had windchills that cold. It's pretty frosty @ -70F!!!!
I bet!  Ive worked in near those temps a few times and it was anything but fun!  When your using a tiger torch on your body to warm up, its a lil rediculous lol

Is the sun closer to you then here?  I can deal with the -27 and sun with no wind.  Today it was -7 and damp as hell. Went right through me.  When we were out saturday, -18 and sunny. Beauty day.  Sunday was -13 with all that snow. Felt much colder.
-25 sunny with no wind is sit on the sled in a hoodie fishin' weather.
43 F here tonight , windy and raining

This morning we had about 400 yards of good smooth ice here. Smooth enough kids down the lane played shinny here Sunday. It was a possibility that we could get to 10 foot depths easily. I was ready to call Fish Farmer and let him know. It's a good spot because the ducks feed there all fall an latter if it doesn't freeze. Usually huge icebergs because the wind piles it and no way to get out there unless you are a Himalayan goat. Today at 4PM green grass and sandy beach. Dave you can send some ice down here for the southern Ont. hardwater guys.  It's always -20 on the top of #5 Blast Furnace on the Bay on a nice day. I really miss that.

And this AM there is another 300 yards of somewhat smooth ice out here. How does that much water freeze overnight when they said it was +3 last night??????? Wind chill must be real, because she was a blowin' hard here all night, must have been from NW because no icebergs. I thought the water sloshing around in the toilet from wind down the vent stack last night was going to splash out of the toilet.  Fish Farmer looking good for you ice trailblazer nuts so far for Erie. Ask me tomorrow might have the beach back, crazy ice.  A dog wandered out onto the ice on the Grand River below the Dunnville Dam the other day and went through. The couple that are the Dog's owner also went through trying to get to the Dog. Lucky there were people close by and heard the cries for help. Dunnville rescue Zodiac was launched and all 3 are fine because of a lightning fast response of the Rescue team and someone watching over them from above for sure. Puppy went to the local vets for a check up and the couple were treated at the local hospital and were released soon after. I hope the couple went and bought Lotto Max tickets after they got warm and dry.  I am not going to preach to the choir but there is a lesson to pass onto others not so ice savvy like these lucky folks.
Just hit 50 F at 10 pm, going to be picking nightcrawlers in January soon.  Edit: up to 53F when we got up at 7am and it rained most of the night, only ice in Niagara will be in my Forty Creek today.
Wait....when did y'all switch to Fahrenheit
